headline: Boeing Stock Rose. Air India Crash Investigators Focus on Fuel Switches.
summary: Boeing  stock rose Wednesday as investors waited for details from flight data recorders from Air India flight 171, which crashed on June 12, less than a minute after taking off from an airport in Ahmedabad, India.  The Times of India reported Tuesday that a preliminary report had been submitted to officials, citing “top sources.”  Boeing didn’t respond to a request for comment about the report.

headline: Boeing Stock Is Rising. Air India Crash Investigators Focus on Fuel Switches.

The Times of India reported Tuesday that a preliminary report had been submitted to officials, citing “top sources.”  Boeing didn’t respond to a request for comment about the report.

headline: Ameresco Hires Seasoned Energy Executive to Lead Strategic Growth in Europe
summary: FRAMINGHAM, Mass., July 09, 2025--Ameresco, Inc., (NYSE: AMRC), a leading energy solutions provider dedicated to helping customers navigate the energy transition, today announced the appointment of Spyros Kairis as General Manager for South, East, and Central Europe. Based in Athens, Greece, Spyros will be responsible for overseeing operations, driving business growth, and managing key projects across the region.

headline: GE Aerospace Resumes Jet Engine Shipments to China Amid Easing Trade Tensions
summary: GE Aerospace (NYSE:GE) is one of the best US stocks to buy and hold in 2025. On July 3, the US government informed GE Aerospace that it could resume shipments of jet engines to China’s Commercial Aircraft Corporation of China/COMAC. The decision signals a de-escalation of US-Sino trade tensions, which also involved concessions from Beijing […]
